Brazil: German adventurer Hans Staden publishes a widely translated account of his detention by the Tupi people of Brazil, ("True Story and Description of a Country of Wild, Naked, Grim, Man-eating People in the New World, America").
Burma: Bayinnaung annexes cis-Salween Shan States; abolishes animal sacrifice at Popa Hill and human sacrifice at Shan Hills
Chile: Death of Lautaro, Caupolicán assumes the role of Mapuche toqui (wartime chief).
China: The Kingdom of Portugal established a permanent settlement in Macau.
Malta: Jean Parisot de Valette is elected Grand Master of the Knights of Malta.
Spain: Battle of St. Quentin (1557): Spain won the battle.
